result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jermaine Watson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Michael Jermaine Watson.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant has another case; 22CM1498. Defense received discovery and offer; case in global resolution posture. Defense requested plea and sentencing date. Court granted defense's request; court will accept other case if global resolution. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Michael Jermaine Watson.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense received discovery and offer and requested adjournment to allow time to communicate with defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz; both appear by video.  Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Whittenberger.  Court took judicial notice of 06CF4182. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Supress Statement.  (Michael J. Watson - #2022007006, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Dismissal.  (Michael J. Watson - #2022007006, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Motion for Speedy Trial (Michael J. Watson #2022007006 - HOC 8885 S. 68TH ST. FRANKLIN, WI. 53132)
Motion to Suppress Evidence Obtained from Search (Michael J. Watson #2022007006 - HOC 8885 S. 68TH ST. FRANKLIN, WI. 53132)

Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness was present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson not in court, defendant in custody.   Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Jermaine Watson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
